entry.title: Mt. Ogura・小倉山
entry.content:
Above the Katsura (Oi) River, looking west at Mt. Ogura last night.

Landmarks from left to right: Daihikaku Temple (on the mountain), Hoshinoya Resort (on the river), Torokko scenic train (red on the right side of the river), Mt. Ogura, Okochi Sanso garden at far right.

entry.title: Geiyo Islands・芸予諸島
entry.content:
Looking north at some of the dozens of islands in the Geiyo Islands chain and the Shimanami Kaido that hopscotches across them, in the Seto Inland Sea between Shikoku and Hiroshima in western Japan. In this section of a larger panorama taken from Imabara in northwest Shikoku, the Oshima, Omishima and Hakata Islands can be seen.

Popular with cyclists, the Shimanami Kaido (aka Nishiseto Expressway) contains 55 bridges and crosses through 9 different islands over a distance of over 59 kilometres (37 miles); linking Shikoku Island with Japan's main Honshu Island.
